content.description: Nice sharp crimpy flake. Top out a little sketchy. use the rock behind you to get up. Start sitting in between the 2 big rocks on the ground.
content.location: As you are walking around the area you will come to an pitched out rock that is a wild looking red orange color. If you come from the main trail you just walk around the first corner on the right and you will see a sweet looking climb.

content.description: Start on the flake system on the right of the rock then move a little left up top to top off. Easy very fun climb.
content.location: Keep walking right from the main trail past the V3 pitch and you will see the big flat wall(sticks out like a sore thumb).

content.description:
Note: it is possible the old rockclimbing.com listing was referencing an area adjacent to but not actually on the Dan's Rock overlook.

 Dans Rock, located in Dan's Mountain WMA, is the highest point in Allegany County, western Maryland, at 2,898 feet above sea level. This mountain was named for Daniel Cresap, an 18th century local historic figure. Dan's Rock is an outcrop of the Pottsville formation on Dan's Mountain. The Pottsville contains sandstones, siltstones, claystones, shales, and several coal beds. These rocks date to the Pennsylvanian Period and are about 300 million years old.

 The erosion resistant quartzite member of the Pottsville formation is a major ridge-maker in western Maryland.
